page.title: 01THE POWDERHALL INCINERATOR
page.content:
The Powderhall Incinerator was opened in 1971 by the Lord Provost at the cost of Â£1900000. It burns 800 tonnes of refuse every week. The chimney is 200 feet tall. There used to be two other incinerators in the city, one at Russell Road and the other at Craig- :millar. One was destroyed by fire, the other was closed down.

Residents in the Wardie and Trinity areas have complained about the dust and the fumes. The Inverleith Associ- :ation protested that the dust was becoming unbearable. It was particu- :larly bad when there was a haar or a light easterly wind. 1300 residents signed a petition for the Health Service to take action. The Inciner- :ator is to be gradually phased out.
